page.title: 08ROYAL CHARTER MOELFRE 1
page.content: On July 9th,1985 Moelfre made headlines in both national and local newspapers and on television. Twelve professional divers have been salvaging the wreck of The Royal Charter for nine weeks and have made spectacular discoveries. The Royal Charter was a steam clipper with over 450 passengers on board with a cargo of gold on her way from Australia to Liverpool. On Oct. 26th,1859 in a freak hurricane The Royal Charter was wrecked on the rocks at Porth Helaeth. Only 40 people survived. The R.Ch's treasures are being brought up daily. The divers may stay here for about a year. A documentary may be made and a book written about this new discovery. Frances Maisey.
